results.content:
If you're looking for a course that will help you get a job...this isn't it. It's all theory, It's all about what is on the PowerPoint slides which glosses over the programs that you thought you were going to learn but don't. 

On one of the slides, he mentions that his resume got him a job and that a similar resume costs $15 bucks. I posted a question asking him to give the name of the resume since I could not find one that looked like his. He hasn't answered the question and this is a new course!

The only reason I didn't give this a one was because there were two halfway decent freebies but that is it. I don't think this was worth the sales price let alone the full price.

response.content:
Hi George, thanks very much for your review.

I am sorry you thought the course was substandard. I hoped I had made it quite clear that the course was primarily theory from the intro videos however on your behalf this seems to not be the case. My intention was to speak about what technology was helpful to know and why in a job search, rather than teaching the subject like so many other courses do fantastically already. 

In regard to your question, I apologise wholeheartedly that this has gone unanswered. My partner and I had taken a large holiday for the first time in a couple of years due to my partner being a full time carer for her ill mother, and throughout this time I did not check my phone in general. A massive error on my behalf. Please rest assured that I always take the time to help people who ask for my help no matter how large or trivial the question is. I am sure the thousands of people I connect with throughout social media can vouch for that. 

Im glad you found the freebies decent. I have been pleased with the responses received from various students who have used them and asking questions about how to change certain elements of the code. 

Regards,
James.
